DataElement.preferredName: Dental Pulp Vital Diagnostic Procedure Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions._Necessary to maintain life. Breathing is a vital function_Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability._the free text field to specify the assessment performed.
